main.name: Andrew von Hillebrandt
main.occupation: computer science student at Georgia Tech,
main.bio: I'm a computer science alumni with an emphasis on Artificial Intelligence and Game Design. I am comfortable with a variety of technologies, including Java, Python, ReactJS, and others, and am experienced with working in agile development cycles and have performed well in many leadership roles. I also like Italian food, video games, the Rat Pack, and Steelers football #HereWeGo
main.contactmessage: Reach out to me if you have questions or potential employment opportunities!

resume.skillmessage: Technologies I am experienced with, and to what degree I am comfortable with them

education.description: Focuses in Artificial Intelligence and Media, succeeded in classes such as Machine Learning, Computer Graphics, Artificial Intelligence, Data Structures, Discrete Mathematics, and many more. Graduated with Highest Honors.

work.title: Junior Associate Software Engineer
work.description: Work as a Salesforce developer for a variety of clients ranging with a variety of differing needs and requirements.

work.title: Information Software Management Co-Op
work.description: Same responsibilities as an intern but with elevated permissions and on a part-time basis.

work.title: Information Software Management Intern
work.description: Responsible for the creation of backend Python scripts that maintained and configured network devices, parsed SQL database inventories for finding missing devices, and maintaining network efficiency and reliability.

work.title: Teaching Assistant
work.description: Served as a teaching assistant for CS2340 - Objects and Design under Dr. Aibek Musaev, held biweekly office hours assisting students with the semester-long JavaFX application they were to develop.

work.company: Student Government Association at Georgia Tech
work.title: JacketPages/Syllabus Repository Project Lead
work.description: Responsible for the maintenance of JacketPages, GT's budget management website for student organizations, and am currently leading a new initiative to develop a syllabus repository using AWS S3 and RDS to provide students easy access to course materials.

work.title: Student Assistant
work.description: Assisted various professors through the university with a variety of technical issues during regular semesters, and assisted the Georgia Tech administration in preparing for remote semesters during the COVID-19 pandemic.

projects.title: GT Syllabus Repository
projects.category: Creating a centralized repository for Georgia Tech syllabi.

projects.title: Project Ambazonia
projects.category: Georgia Tech Junior Design project to help refugees in Nigeria.

projects.title: Personal Website
projects.category: The website you are on right now!

projects.title: Minesweeper AI
projects.category: An artificial intelligence that algorithmically beats Minesweeper.

projects.title: EvoSlash
projects.category: Video game design group's final project: hack-and-slash zombie game!

testimonials.text: Man, I wish we had this guy around when I was fighting Lord Voldemort! He could have easily written a script that could have parsed the world for 7 horcruxes and deleted them, no problem. Truly wonderful programmer.

This man might be the greatest programmer of all time. He has excelled in all of his coursework at a prestigious research institute, feels comfortable with front-end web development and software engineering/script development, and is an incredibly hard worker and excels in leadership roles.

Where to begin? If we had Andrew during WWII, we would have cracked the riddle of the Engima machine in mere moments and the war would've ended far earlier. A generational programmer, and extraordinarily humble as well.

I don't think I would have won any of my 6 championships without this young man's progrmaming acumen, and, believe it or not, his better-than-average basketball ability. His jumpshot is not bad! Anyways, you should definitely hire him, you will not regret it.
